section.heading: Budget structure for new agencies.
section.text: The Chief Financial Officer may, for the purpose of establishing a budget structure for new agencies within the financial system for Fiscal Year 2022:

para.text: Create new agencies in the financial system, as necessary, and reallocate funds in the Office of the Chief Financial Officer for the purpose of implementing Chapter 6D of Title 4; and
Create the Department of Buildings and redesignate the Department of Consumer and Regulatory Affairs ("DCRA") as the Department of Licensing and Consumer Protection in the financial system; and
Reallocate funds budgeted in DCRA and in the Non-Departmental Account as necessary to implement Chapter 5B of Title 10 and § 6-507.

annotations.annotation: For temporary (90 days) creation of this section, see § 1122 of Fiscal Year 2022 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2021 (D.C. Act 24-159, Aug. 23, 2021, 68 DCR 008602).
